verses.kjv: And in the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams, wherewith his spirit was troubled, and his sleep brake from him.
verses.ct: During the 2nd year of Nebuchadnezzar's reign, Nebuchadnezzar had dreams that deeply disturbed his spirit, and he couldn't sleep.

verses.kjv: Then the king commanded to call the magicians, and the astrologers, and the sorcerers, and the Chaldeans, for to shew the king his dreams. So they came and stood before the king.
verses.ct: So the king ordered that the magicians, astrologers, sorcerers, and Chaldean wise men be summoned to explain his dreams to him. They came and stood in the king's presence.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto them, I have dreamed a dream, and my spirit was troubled to know the dream.
verses.ct: The king told them, "I've had a dream, and my spirit is troubled because I need to understand it."

verses.kjv: Then spake the Chaldeans to the king in Syriack, O king, live for ever: tell thy servants the dream, and we will shew the interpretation.
verses.ct: The Chaldeans spoke to the king in Aramaic: "Long live the king! Tell your servants the dream, and we will provide the interpretation."

verses.kjv: The king answered and said to the Chaldeans, The thing is gone from me: if ye will not make known unto me the dream, with the interpretation thereof, ye shall be cut in pieces, and your houses shall be made a dunghill.
verses.ct: The king replied to the Chaldeans, "My decision is final: if you don't tell me both the dream and its meaning, you will be torn apart, and your homes will be turned into rubble."

verses.kjv: But if ye shew the dream, and the interpretation thereof, ye shall receive of me gifts and rewards and great honour: therefore shew me the dream, and the interpretation thereof.
verses.ct: "But if you reveal the dream along with its meaning, you will receive gifts, rewards, and great honor from me. So tell me the dream and its meaning."

verses.kjv: They answered again and said, Let the king tell his servants the dream, and we will shew the interpretation of it.
verses.ct: They responded a 2nd time, "Let the king describe the dream to his servants, and we will give the interpretation."

verses.kjv: The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain the time, because ye see the thing is gone from me.
verses.ct: The king replied, "I know for certain that you're stalling for time, because you can see that my decision is final."

verses.kjv: But if ye will not make known unto me the dream, there is but one decree for you: for ye have prepared lying and corrupt words to speak before me, till the time be changed: therefore tell me the dream, and I shall know that ye can shew me the interpretation thereof.
verses.ct: "If you can't tell me the dream, there is only one sentence for you. You've conspired to speak lies and deceptive words to me, hoping the situation will change. So tell me the dream, and then I'll know you can actually give me its interpretation."

verses.kjv: The Chaldeans answered before the king, and said, There is not a man upon the earth that can shew the king’s matter: therefore there is no king, lord, nor ruler, that asked such things at any magician, or astrologer, or Chaldean.
verses.ct: The Chaldeans answered the king, "There is no one on earth who can do what the king asks. No king, ruler, or lord has ever demanded such a thing from any magician, astrologer, or Chaldean wise man."

verses.kjv: And it is a rare thing that the king requireth, and there is none other that can shew it before the king, except the gods, whose dwelling is not with flesh.
verses.ct: "What the king demands is impossible. No one can reveal it to the king except the gods, and they don't live among humans."

verses.kjv: For this cause the king was angry and very furious, and commanded to destroy all the wise men of Babylon.
verses.ct: This made the king furious and enraged, and he gave the order to execute all the wise men of Babylon.

verses.kjv: And the decree went forth that the wise men should be slain; and they sought Daniel and his fellows to be slain.
verses.ct: The decree was issued that the wise men were to be killed, and soldiers went looking for Daniel and his companions to execute them as well.

verses.kjv: Then Daniel answered with counsel and wisdom to Arioch the captain of the king’s guard, which was gone forth to slay the wise men of Babylon:
verses.ct: Daniel responded with tact and wisdom to Arioch, the commander of the king's guard, who had gone out to kill the wise men of Babylon.

verses.kjv: He answered and said to Arioch the king’s captain, Why is the decree so hasty from the king? Then Arioch made the thing known to Daniel.
verses.ct: He asked Arioch, the king's commander, "Why has the king issued such an urgent decree?" Arioch then explained the situation to Daniel.

verses.kjv: Then Daniel went in, and desired of the king that he would give him time, and that he would shew the king the interpretation.
verses.ct: Daniel went to the king and asked him to grant some time, promising that he would present the interpretation to the king.

verses.kjv: Then Daniel went to his house, and made the thing known to Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, his companions:
verses.ct: Then Daniel returned to his home and told his companions Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah what had happened.

verses.kjv: That they would desire mercies of the God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his fellows should not perish with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.
verses.ct: He urged them to plead for mercy from the God of heaven regarding this mystery, so that Daniel and his friends wouldn't be executed along with the rest of Babylon's wise men.

verses.kjv: Then was the secret revealed unto Daniel in a night vision. Then Daniel blessed the God of heaven.
verses.ct: That night, the mystery was revealed to Daniel in a vision. Daniel then praised the God of heaven.

verses.kjv: Daniel answered and said, Blessed be the name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are his:
verses.ct: Daniel declared, "Praise the name of God forever and ever, because wisdom and power belong to him.

verses.kjv: And he changeth the times and the seasons: he removeth kings, and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom unto the wise, and knowledge to them that know understanding:
verses.ct: He controls the changing of eras and seasons. He removes kings and establishes kings. He gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to those with understanding.

verses.kjv: He revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the darkness, and the light dwelleth with him.
verses.ct: He uncovers what is deep and hidden. He knows what lies in the darkness, and light resides with him.

verses.kjv: I thank thee, and praise thee, O thou God of my fathers, who hast given me wisdom and might, and hast made known unto me now what we desired of thee: for thou hast now made known unto us the king’s matter.
verses.ct: I thank you and praise you, God of my ancestors, because you have given me wisdom and strength. You have now revealed to me what we asked of you — you have shown us the king's matter."

verses.kjv: Therefore Daniel went in unto Arioch, whom the king had ordained to destroy the wise men of Babylon: he went and said thus unto him; Destroy not the wise men of Babylon: bring me in before the king, and I will shew unto the king the interpretation.
verses.ct: So Daniel went to Arioch, whom the king had appointed to execute the wise men of Babylon. He told him, "Don't execute the wise men of Babylon. Take me to the king, and I will give him the interpretation."

verses.kjv: Then Arioch brought in Daniel before the king in haste, and said thus unto him, I have found a man of the captives of Judah, that will make known unto the king the interpretation.
verses.ct: Arioch quickly brought Daniel to the king and told him, "I have found a man among the exiles from Judah who can give the king the interpretation."

verses.kjv: The king answered and said to Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, Art thou able to make known unto me the dream which I have seen, and the interpretation thereof?
verses.ct: The king said to Daniel, who was also called Belteshazzar, "Are you able to tell me the dream I had and explain its meaning?"

verses.kjv: Daniel answered in the presence of the king, and said, The secret which the king hath demanded cannot the wise men, the astrologers, the magicians, the soothsayers, shew unto the king;
verses.ct: Daniel answered the king, "No wise man, astrologer, magician, or fortune-teller can reveal to the king the mystery he has asked about.

verses.kjv: But there is a God in heaven that revealeth secrets, and maketh known to the king Nebuchadnezzar what shall be in the latter days. Thy dream, and the visions of thy head upon thy bed, are these;
verses.ct: But there is a God in heaven who reveals mysteries, and he has shown King Nebuchadnezzar what will happen in the days to come. Here is your dream and the visions that passed through your mind as you lay on your bed:

verses.kjv: As for thee, O king, thy thoughts came into thy mind upon thy bed, what should come to pass hereafter: and he that revealeth secrets maketh known to thee what shall come to pass.
verses.ct: As you were lying in bed, your thoughts turned to what would happen in the future, and the one who reveals mysteries showed you what is going to take place.

verses.kjv: But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for any wisdom that I have more than any living, but for their sakes that shall make known the interpretation to the king, and that thou mightest know the thoughts of thy heart.
verses.ct: As for me, this mystery was not revealed to me because I have greater wisdom than anyone else alive. Rather, it was revealed so that the interpretation could be made known to the king, and so that you would understand the thoughts of your mind.

verses.kjv: Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and the form thereof was terrible.
verses.ct: Your Majesty, in your vision you saw a massive statue. This enormous statue, dazzling in its brilliance, stood in front of you, and its appearance was terrifying.

verses.kjv: This image’s head was of fine gold, his breast and his arms of silver, his belly and his thighs of brass,
verses.ct: The head of the statue was made of pure gold, its chest and arms were silver, and its midsection and thighs were bronze.

verses.kjv: His legs of iron, his feet part of iron and part of clay.
verses.ct: Its legs were iron, and its feet were partly iron and partly clay.

verses.kjv: Thou sawest till that a stone was cut out without hands, which smote the image upon his feet that were of iron and clay, and brake them to pieces.
verses.ct: As you watched, a stone was cut out — but not by human hands — and it struck the statue on its feet of iron and clay, shattering them.

verses.kjv: Then was the iron, the clay, the brass, the silver, and the gold, broken to pieces together, and became like the chaff of the summer threshingfloors; and the wind carried them away, that no place was found for them: and the stone that smote the image became a great mountain, and filled the whole earth.
verses.ct: Then the iron, clay, bronze, silver, and gold all shattered at once and became like chaff on a threshing floor in summer. The wind swept them away without leaving a trace. But the stone that struck the statue grew into a huge mountain and filled the entire earth.

verses.kjv: This is the dream; and we will tell the interpretation thereof before the king.
verses.ct: That was the dream, and now we will explain its meaning to the king.

verses.kjv: Thou, O king, art a king of kings: for the God of heaven hath given thee a kingdom, power, and strength, and glory.
verses.ct: Your Majesty, you are a king of kings. The God of heaven has given you dominion, power, strength, and glory.

verses.kjv: And wheresoever the children of men dwell, the beasts of the field and the fowls of the heaven hath he given into thine hand, and hath made thee ruler over them all. Thou art this head of gold.
verses.ct: Wherever people live, and over the wild animals and the birds of the heavens, he has placed them under your authority and made you ruler over them all. You are the head of gold.

verses.kjv: And after thee shall arise another kingdom inferior to thee, and another third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all the earth.
verses.ct: After you, another kingdom will rise that is inferior to yours, and then a 3rd kingdom, one of bronze, which will rule over the whole earth.

verses.kjv: And the fourth kingdom shall be strong as iron: forasmuch as iron breaketh in pieces and subdueth all things: and as iron that breaketh all these, shall it break in pieces and bruise.
verses.ct: A 4th kingdom will be as strong as iron. Just as iron crushes and breaks everything, so this kingdom will crush and shatter all the others.

verses.kjv: And whereas thou sawest the feet and toes, part of potters’ clay, and part of iron, the kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in it of the strength of the iron, forasmuch as thou sawest the iron mixed with miry clay.
verses.ct: You saw that the feet and toes were partly potter's clay and partly iron. This means the kingdom will be divided. It will have some of the strength of iron in it, just as you saw iron mixed with soft clay.

verses.kjv: And as the toes of the feet were part of iron, and part of clay, so the kingdom shall be partly strong, and partly broken.
verses.ct: The toes were partly iron and partly clay, meaning the kingdom will be partly strong and partly brittle.

verses.kjv: And whereas thou sawest iron mixed with miry clay, they shall mingle themselves with the seed of men: but they shall not cleave one to another, even as iron is not mixed with clay.
verses.ct: Just as you saw iron mixed with soft clay, the people of this kingdom will try to unite with one another through intermarriage, but they will not hold together, just as iron does not bond with clay.

verses.kjv: And in the days of these kings shall the God of heaven set up a kingdom, which shall never be destroyed: and the kingdom shall not be left to other people, but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand for ever.
verses.ct: During the time of those kings, the God of heaven will establish a kingdom that will never be destroyed. It will not be handed over to another people. Instead, it will crush and put an end to all those kingdoms, and it will endure forever.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as thou sawest that the stone was cut out of the mountain without hands, and that it brake in pieces the iron, the brass, the clay, the silver, and the gold; the great God hath made known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter: and the dream is certain, and the interpretation thereof sure.
verses.ct: This is the meaning of the stone you saw cut from the mountain without human hands — the one that shattered the iron, bronze, clay, silver, and gold. The great God has revealed to the king what will happen in the future. The dream is trustworthy, and its interpretation is reliable."

verses.kjv: Then the king Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face, and worshipped Daniel, and commanded that they should offer an oblation and sweet odours unto him.
verses.ct: Then King Nebuchadnezzar bowed down with his face to the ground and paid honor to Daniel. He ordered that an offering and incense be presented to him.

verses.kjv: The king answered unto Daniel, and said, Of a truth it is, that your God is a God of gods, and a Lord of kings, and a revealer of secrets, seeing thou couldest reveal this secret.
verses.ct: The king said to Daniel, "Truly, your God is the God above all gods and the Lord above all kings, and a revealer of mysteries, since you were able to reveal this mystery."

verses.kjv: Then the king made Daniel a great man, and gave him many great gifts, and made him ruler over the whole province of Babylon, and chief of the governors over all the wise men of Babylon.
verses.ct: Then the king promoted Daniel to a high position and gave him many lavish gifts. He made him ruler over the entire province of Babylon and head administrator over all of Babylon's wise men.

verses.kjv: Then Daniel requested of the king, and he set Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, over the affairs of the province of Babylon: but Daniel sat in the gate of the king.
verses.ct: At Daniel's request, the king appointed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego to manage the affairs of the province of Babylon, while Daniel himself served in the king's court.
